questions.question: What is the main goal of Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)?

answers.c: To understand the underlying patterns in the data

explanations.b: Cleaning is related but not the main goal of EDA.
explanations.c: Correct! EDA aims to discover patterns, anomalies, and insights.
explanations.d: Deployment is not part of EDA.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method used for visualizing data in EDA?

explanations.c: Scatter plots show relationships between variables.
explanations.d: Correct! All of these visualizations are used in EDA.

questions.question: Which of the following is commonly examined at the beginning of EDA?

explanations.a: Correct! EDA begins with understanding data types and structure.
explanations.b: Model architecture is not part of EDA.
explanations.c: Accuracy is checked after training a model, not during EDA.
explanations.d: Hyperparameters are tuned after model training.

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used to identify outliers during EDA?

explanations.a: Correct! Box plots help visualize outliers in numerical data.
explanations.b: One-hot encoding is used for categorical variables.
explanations.d: Train-test split is done after EDA.

questions.question: Which EDA technique helps summarize the central tendency and variability of numerical data?

explanations.a: Correct! Descriptive statistics include mean, median, variance, and percentiles.
explanations.b: Scatter plots show relationships, not central tendency.
explanations.c: Feature engineering is performed after understanding the data.
explanations.d: Correlation matrices show relationships between features.

questions.question: Which visualization or tool is commonly used to understand relationships between multiple numerical variables?

explanations.a: Correct! Correlation matrices show relationships between multiple variables.
explanations.b: Bar charts are used for categorical data.
explanations.d: Removing duplicates is data cleaning, not relationship analysis.
